intro: Elatostema reticulatum var. glabrum, commonly known as the smooth nettleleaf, is a small herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes true nettles, and is characterized by its delicate, often hairy leaves. The variety glabrum is distinguished by its smooth, hairless foliage compared to other varieties in the species. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which are borne on short pedicels.
